ch.nolix.element.GUI

Class BorderWidget<BW extends BorderWidget<BW,BWS>,BWS extends BorderWidgetStructure<BWS>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.nolix.core.entity.Entity
      • ch.nolix.element.core.MutableElement<ONE>
        • ch.nolix.element.bases.OptionalNamableElement<CE>
          • ch.nolix.element.bases.ConfigurableElement<W>
            • ch.nolix.element.GUI.Widget<BW,BWS>
              • ch.nolix.element.GUI.BackgroundWidget<BW,BWS>
                • ch.nolix.element.GUI.BorderWidget<BW,BWS>
  • Type Parameters:
    BW - The type of a border widget.
    BWS - The type of the widget structures of a border widget.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IController, IFluentObject<BW>, Namable<BW>, Named, OptionalNamable<BW>, OptionalTokenable<BW>, Resettable, Tokenable<BW>, Tokened, Typed, TypeRequestable, Configurable, Specifiable, Specified, IElement
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Console, Container, TextLineWidget

    public abstract class BorderWidget<BW extends BorderWidget<BW,BWS>,BWS extends BorderWidgetStructure<BWS>>
extends BackgroundWidget<BW,BWS>
    A border widget is a background widget that can have individual borders at each of its 4 sides. The content of a border widget is the border widget without borders and paddings. The methods concerning the content of a border widget are not public.
    Author:
    Silvan Wyss
